isis.stitle: CAB: 4100, 4200, 4300 AND 4400 MODELS - REMOVE - SUN SHADE

svcsubproc.title: Remove Sun Shade on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. RIGHT SIDE SUN SHADE CLEARANCE LIGHT
3. LEFT SIDE SUN SHADE CLEARANCE LIGHT

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 26 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove self-tapping screws (Item 1) attaching both right and left side sun shade clearance lights (Items 2 and 3) and center sun shade clearance light (Item 4) to sun shade (Item 5). Lay self-tapping screws out of the way and save for installation.

Pull right and left side sun shade clearance lights (Items 2 and 3) and center sun shade clearance light (Item 4) out of sun shade (Item 5) (they will hang free from wiring harness) to gain access to sun shade hex flanged head mounting screws (Item 6).

Reach through clearance light openings and remove three hex flanged head mounting screws (Item 6) attaching sun shade (Item 5) to the sun shade mounting bracket (Item 7), which is bonded to cab roof (item 8). Lay hex flanged head mounting screws out of the way and save for installation.

Pull sun shade (Item 5) away from sun shade mounting bracket (Item 7) until wiring harness connector (item 9) is pulled through wiring harness hole (Item 10) in sun shade mounting bracket. Disconnect sun shade connector (Item 11) from wiring harness connector and remove sun shade. Place sun shade on clean, dry surface to keep it from getting scratched or damaged.
